slide.title: Lesson Goals
slide.p: This short lesson introduces some source code management notions.

ul.li: Each project needs a repository, somewhere for code to live
A project can have repositories per module
Each project needs a version control tool

div.p: Gitflow workflow - branching conventions, forking, branching
All development is done on the "develop" branch, which is merged into the "master" branch to form a new release. If you only deploy from the "master" branch, conflicts don't affect it.

slide.title: Gitflow Gotchas
slide.p: Gitflow is not the only workflow possible, and it is not without problems...

ul.li: Merge conflicts - when two people update the same stuff
Synchronization - when your project gets hopelessly out of synch with the team's
Unhelpful commit messages - what/who broke something
Unhelpful pull request descriptions - has something already been done
Properly attributing work done - not just for marks
